title: cmake error in all machines when trying to rebuild from source
body_html:
Hello,
I followed the instruction here:https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch#installation to build pytorch from source
instead using:
sudo python2 setup.py install
I used:
cmake .. & sudo make install -jnproc``

and the same thing was did in 3 ubuntu 16.04 machine,and pytorch works in these machines now,but when trying to run:
cd build & rm -rf * & cmake ..
I got all kinds of errors like:

CMake Error at cmake/External/nnpack.cmake:73 (set_property):
  set_property could not find TARGET nnpack.  Perhaps it has not yet been
  created.
Call Stack (most recent call first):
  cmake/Dependencies.cmake:94 (include)
  CMakeLists.txt:206 (include)


CMake Error at cmake/External/nnpack.cmake:74 (set_property):
  set_property could not find TARGET pthreadpool.  Perhaps it has not yet
  been created.
Call Stack (most recent call first):
  cmake/Dependencies.cmake:94 (include)
  CMakeLists.txt:206 (include)

and I have tried in 3 machines,and they all give similar cmake errors,what did I wrong?

body:
Hello,
    I followed the instruction here:https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch#installation to build pytorch from source
instead using:
`    sudo python2 setup.py install`
I used:
`     cmake .. & sudo make install -j `nproc``

and the same thing was did in 3 ubuntu 16.04 machine,and pytorch works in these machines now,but when trying to run:
`      cd build & rm -rf * & cmake ..  `
I got all kinds of errors like:
```
CMake Error at cmake/External/nnpack.cmake:73 (set_property):
  set_property could not find TARGET nnpack.  Perhaps it has not yet been
  created.
Call Stack (most recent call first):
  cmake/Dependencies.cmake:94 (include)
  CMakeLists.txt:206 (include)


CMake Error at cmake/External/nnpack.cmake:74 (set_property):
  set_property could not find TARGET pthreadpool.  Perhaps it has not yet
  been created.
Call Stack (most recent call first):
  cmake/Dependencies.cmake:94 (include)
  CMakeLists.txt:206 (include)
```
and I have tried in 3 machines,and they all give similar cmake errors,what did I wrong?
